title: Population of Michigan , by race and ethnicity 2018
summary: This bar chart has 8 columns on the x axis representing Race, and Number of residents in each Race on the y axis.
The Number of residents is appeared to be the highest at Race White alone and lowest at Race Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone.
The Number of residents of Race White alone is 2272.35% larger than the minimum value at Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone.
min_summary: This bar chart has 8 columns on the x axis representing Race, and Number of residents in each Race on the y axis.
The Number of residents is appeared to be the highest at Race White alone and lowest at Race Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 8 columns on the x axis representing Race, and Number of residents in each Race on the y axis.
The Number of residents is appeared to be the highest at Race White alone and lowest at Race Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone.
The Number of residents of Race White alone is 2272.35% larger than the minimum value at Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone.
max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Number of residents for 8 number of Races.
The maximum Number of residents 7476047.0 is found at Race White alone and the minimum is found at Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone where Race is 3290.0.
The Number of residents of Race White alone is 2272.35% larger than the minimum value at Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone.

Race White alone is higher than any other Races with value 7476047.0, followed by Black or African American alone, and Hispanic or Latino (of any race). Down to Race Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone with the lowest value 3290.0.
The Race Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone tends to be 5.98 percent lower than average.
